title.narrative: 5.1 SAFE WATER SUPPLY

description.narrative: 5.1 Increased capacity to improve water quality and functionality and to deliver and sustain access to safe water (especially in schools and health-care facilities), which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and their families have improved and equitable access to and use of safe and sustainable drinking water and sanitation services, and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.1 Increased capacity to improve water quality and functionality and to deliver and sustain access to safe water (especially inschools and health-care facilities)

description.narrative: Around 52,000 people from the community and;197schools and 22 health care facilities have gained access to the safe water supply because of UNICEF direct support with UNICEF’s direct support through the systematic implementation of climate-resilient water safety planning concept at community, schools, and healthcare facilities. Under UNICEF direct support 16 local governments (municipalities) established a water quality monitoring mechanism. Furthermore, the localization of SDG 6.1 through the ‘water safe community initiative is getting momentum with buy-in from the local government. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of local bodies (Municipalities) with water quality monitoring mechanism operationalized(55485)
